means: 使赤裸( denude的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The Embassy is now denuded of all foreign and local staff.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在大使馆里所有的外国和当地工作人员都清空了。

sentence.Network_en: Many hillsides had been denuded of trees.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多山坡上都已经光秃秃的，没有任何树木了。

entry.def: To denude an area means to destroy the plants in it.

example.ex: Mining would pollute the lake and denude the forest...
example.tran: 采矿会污染湖水，毁掉森林。

example.ex: Many hillsides had been denuded of trees.
example.tran: 许多山坡上都已经光秃秃的，没有任何树木了。

entry.def: To denude someone or something of a particular thing means to take it away from them.

example.ex: The Embassy is now denuded of all foreign and local staff...
example.tran: 现在大使馆里所有的外国和当地工作人员都清空了。

example.ex: In such areas we see villages denuded of young people.
example.tran: 在这些地区，我们在村子里根本看不到年轻人。

means.word_mean: 1. without the natural or usual covering;

auth_sentence.content: The forests had been denuded here as well.
auth_sentence.res_content: The forests had been denuded here as well.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The forests had been denuded here as well.

auth_sentence.content: The park was denuded of its timber.
auth_sentence.res_content: The park was denuded of its timber.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The park was denuded of its timber.

auth_sentence.content: Impacts would have denuded these moons of any atmospheres they ever had.
auth_sentence.res_content: Impacts would have denuded these moons of any atmospheres they ever had.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Impacts would have denuded these moons of any atmospheres they ever had.
